properties.areaDesc: Wayne, TN; Lawrence, TN; Giles, TN
properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 10 at 1:18PM CST until February 10 at 4:15PM CST by NWS Nashville TN
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a

* Flood Advisory for...
Wayne County in Middle Tennessee...
Lawrence County in Middle Tennessee...
Giles County in Middle Tennessee...

* Until 415 PM CST.

* At 114 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated rain that is causing minor
flooding in the advisory area. Doppler radar estimates 1 to 2.5
inches of rain have fallen. Rain will move out of the advisory
area in the next hour, but runoff will keep low water crossings
dangerously high for the next several hours.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Lawrenceburg, Pulaski, Waynesboro, Loretto, Collinwood, Ardmore,
St. Joseph, Elkton, Minor Hill, Ethridge, Lynnville, Cypress Inn,
Lutts, Goodspring, Leoma, Westpoint, Frankewing, Iron City and
Prospect.

Additional rainfall of one quarter inch is expected over the area
in the next hour before showers taper off.
properties.instruction:
In hilly terrain there are several low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.

A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
